newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH SHIPBUILDER TO GET CREDIT FROM PEKAO SA.
newsitem.headline: POLISH SHIPBUILDER TO GET CREDIT FROM PEKAO SA.

text.p: Poland's state-owned bank Pekao SA will give more than a dozen million dollars in credit to its subsidiary Build Ship which will order the completion of a half finished ship in the bankrupt Gdansk yard, an official said.

Janusz Sledzinski, the plenipotentiary of the Gdansk shipyard's receiver told a news conference he expected the vessel would probably be delivered to the Norwegian ship-owner Seven Seas Carriers in September.
"Pekao SA will lend money not to the Gdansk shipyard, which does not have credit worthiness, but to Build Ship, which will order the completion of the construction," Sledzinski said.
He said the bank would take the ship's hull as collateral for the loan while the payment for the finished ship was guaranteed by a letter of credit from Den Norske Bank.
The order will create some 800 jobs in the shipyard which has layed-off more than 2,500 after it went bankrupt last year on debts of 415 million zlotys.
